subject: Technology
title: The Moon Landing: TV's Greatest Moment
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Moon Landing: TV's Greatest Moment.

hook.text: On July 20, 1969, an estimated 600 million people watched one man step onto the moon, live, on their televisions.

buildup.text: NASA installed a special camera on the lunar module that transmitted grainy, ghostly images back to Earth.

discovery.text: The signal traveled 240,000 miles at the speed of light. There was a 1.3-second delay between the moon and your TV.

twist.text: The broadcast was technically terrible: low resolution, washed out, hard to see. But nobody cared. It was the moon.

climax.text: The moon landing remains the most-watched live broadcast in history. Television made the world share one moment.

punchline.text: 600 million people watched humanity's greatest step. On a fuzzy TV screen.

quiz.question: How many people watched the moon landing on television?
